definition: bird's nest/nickname for Beijing 2008 Olympic stadium
Chaohu prefecture-level city in Anhui/Chaohu lake
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
Juchao district of Chaohu city 巢湖市[Chao2 hu2 shi4], Anhui
lit. the whole nest came out (to fight us)/a turnout in full force (of a gang of villains)
Juchao district of Chaohu city 巢湖[Chao2 hu2], Anhui
Huang Chao peasant uprising 875-884 in late Tang, led by Huang Chao
the magpie made a nest, the turtledove dwells in it (idiom)/to reap where one has not sown

sentences.english: The "Crows Nest" has screened venting to provide additional ventilation.
sentences.chinese: 在“烏鴉巢”的甄別，以提供額外的排氣通風。

sentences.english: At medium power, this meningioma is composed of whorled nests of cells.
sentences.chinese: 中倍鏡，腦膜瘤由旋渦狀瘤細胞巢組成。

sentences.english: The following three page listings show a simple nested master page configuration.
sentences.chinese: 下列三個頁面清單顯示了簡單的巢狀主版頁面組態。

sentences.english: Small finch-like indonesian weaverbird that frequents rice fields.
sentences.chinese: 經常在稻田活動的印尼類似雀鳥的小織巢鳥。

sentences.english: Even birds like to spend time alone and will run away from their nest sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 即使是鳥也喜歡獨處，而且時不時地會離開自己的巢。

sentences.english: Slience will carry your voice like the nest that holds the sleeping birds.
sentences.chinese: 沉默能承載你的聲音，就像能托住睡鳥的巢。

sentences.english: Her nest was beautifully constructed out of bits of rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 她廢物利用漂亮地搭建了巢窩。

sentences.english: The nest of a bird, such as an eagle, built on a cliff or other high place.
sentences.chinese: 猛禽的巢鳥巢，如鷹巢，築於懸崖或其他高處。

sentences.english: The baby eagle liked the nest. It was the only world he had ever known.
sentences.chinese: 小鷹喜歡這個巢，這是它出生以來所知道的唯一世界。

sentences.english: The tumor cell nests are separated from each other by abundant myxoid stroma.
sentences.chinese: 下圖見瘤細胞巢被豐富的粘液樣間質所分隔。

sentences.english: Edible bird's nest is the nest made purely of swiftlet's saliva secretion.
sentences.chinese: 食用燕窩是金絲燕的巢純粹的唾液分泌。

sentences.english: Other types of bee make their nests in holes in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 其他種的蜂在地底下的洞築它們的巢。

sentences.english: They will mate with single males in return for the small stones essential to build their nests.
sentences.chinese: 他們將與隊友的單身男性爲基本的巢小石頭的回報。

sentences.english: Nests and cocoons provide security for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 巢和繭爲野生動物提供了安全保障。

sentences.english: When they actually perform the drumming display at the nest, it does seem to have a rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 當他們在巢上實際敲擊展示時，聽起來是有節律的。

definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
center or bull's eye of an archery target (old)/goal/target
